BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: Charity Guild of Catholic Women of

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: To sanctify Guild members and practice charity by rendering assistance to Houston area children.
IRS990.Desc: The Charity Guild is comprised of members who fulfill specific service requirements with respect to the purposes and activities of the Guild. The Charity Guild Shop, staffed almost entirely by volunteers, provides consignment-for-sale and donation opportunities to individuals. The funds raised in the shop along with contributions sustain the organization and provide for grants to non-profit organizations that serve low income children. In fiscal year 2021-2022, the guild provided $548,399 in grants to children's charities.

RecipientBusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: Aid to Victims of Domestic Abuse

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrantTxt: Cardinal Circle, Inner City Schools Fund
Clothing assistance to low income children

RecipientBusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: Duchesne Academy of the Sacred Heart

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrantTxt: Art carts for Texas Children's Hospital
No Kid on the Floor project
School supplies, clothing for refugee children

RecipientBusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: Our Lady of Fatima Catholic School
St John Paul II Catholic School

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Charity Guild makes grants to various organizations for the benefit of children in the Harris County area. Recipients are nominated and championed by members and must be approved by the full membership. A committee reviews grant applicants to ensure that organizations are eligible in that they are 501(c)(3) organizations that benefit children in the Harris County area.

The primary purpose of the Guild is the sanctification of its members under the patronage of the Immaculate Heart of Mary, principally through the practice of the spiritual and corporal works of mercy and practice of charity by providing financial support to organizations in the Greater Houston area that assist all children in need, regardless of race or creed.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Charity Guild of Catholic Women's membership is made up of Catholic women in the Greater Houston area. Active members volunteer in the guild shop and vote on major decisions. Associate members and provisional members do not have voting rights.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The active membership elects a nominating committee annually. The nominating committee recommends a slate of candidates for the executive board. The active membership then votes on the slate of candidates as presented.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Active members must approve changes to the organization's by-laws and all large non-budgeted expenses prior to payment.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Finance Committee reviews Form 990 and a copy of the tax return is provided to all board members prior to filing with the IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: All officers and board members are required to report any potential conflicts of interest to Board leadership.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
